metadata.description:
This data set contains the meteorological element observation system data from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015 of the naked earth station downstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in Inner Mongolia ejin banner dalaihubu town four road bridge, the underlying surface is bare ground.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 101.1326e, 41.9993n and 878m above sea level.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared surface thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm and 4cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil moisture sensor is buried 2cm and 4cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Radiation observation projects are: four components (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: c), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm) (unit: degrees c).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;The four-component long-wave radiation occurred between April and July 26, 2015 due to sensor problems, data was missing;The soil heat flux was adjusted on June 5 and then decreased.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游裸地站气象要素观测系统数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是裸地。观测点的经纬度是101.1326E, 41.9993N，海拔878m。四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外表面温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比) 、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；四分量长波辐射在2015.6.04-7.26之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；土壤热通量在6月5日做了调整，之后数值变小；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更为复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是利用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，该实验针对异质土地表面，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of meteorological parameter measurements taken at the Daman superstation in the central oasis?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，气象参数测量的频率是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a hydrometeorological data collection method in the context of oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，水文气象数据收集方法是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: A hydrometeorological data collection method in the context of oasis-desert systems involves using automatic weather stations that record data every 10 minutes. These stations capture various parameters, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，水文气象数据收集方法涉及使用自动气象站，每10分钟记录一次数据。这些站点捕获各种参数，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in obtaining accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures in arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区获取准确的土壤和植被成分温度面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures in arid regions include image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, which can lead to misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels. This misclassification can result in overestimation of canopy temperature and introduce uncertainties in temperature estimates due to factors like atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance errors.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，获取准确的土壤和植被成分温度面临的挑战包括图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，可能导致土壤和植被像素的误分类。这种误分类可能导致对冠层温度的高估，并由于大气上行辐射和透射误差等因素引入温度估计的不确定性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data quality control measures of the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 meteorological dataset compare to those employed in datasets from oasis–desert systems in terms of handling missing or erroneous data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验气象数据集的数据质量控制措施与绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集在处理缺失或错误数据方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset uses specific markers for missing data, such as -6999, and removes data that exceed physical limits or instrument ranges. In contrast, the oasis–desert systems datasets involve a more comprehensive process that includes data collection, processing, and archiving, indicating a structured approach to data management. Both datasets emphasize quality control, but the focus and methods differ based on the specific challenges and data types involved.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集使用特定标记表示缺失数据，例如-6999，并删除超出物理限制或仪器范围的数据。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统数据集涉及更全面的过程，包括数据收集、处理和归档，表明了一种结构化的数据管理方法。这两个数据集都强调质量控制，但由于面临的具体挑战和数据类型不同，关注点和方法也有所不同。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in meteorological and hydrometeorological data collection methods between the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 and oasis–desert systems datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验与绿洲-沙漠系统数据集在气象和水文气象数据收集方法上的差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset collects meteorological data using automatic stations with specific instruments like four-component radiometers and soil moisture sensors. The oasis–desert systems dataset, however, integrates both automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems to capture a wider range of parameters, including carbon and methane fluxes, suggesting a more extensive data collection framework tailored to capturing complex ecosystem interactions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集使用自动气象站收集气象数据，配备有四分量辐射计和土壤湿度传感器等特定仪器。然而，绿洲-沙漠系统数据集则整合了自动气象站和涡度协方差系统，以捕捉更广泛的参数，包括碳和甲烷通量，表明其数据收集框架更为广泛，旨在捕捉复杂生态系统的相互作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying factors could contribute to the observed variations in soil temperature and moisture data in the arid regions, and how might these factors affect the accuracy of data collection methods like remote sensing and ground-based observations?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，土壤温度和湿度数据的观察变化可能受到多种潜在因素的影响，这些因素可能会影响数据收集方法的准确性，例如遥感和地面观测。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Variations in soil temperature and moisture data could be influenced by several factors, including the heterogeneous nature of the land surface, differences in soil and vegetation types, as well as climatic conditions such as precipitation and air temperature. These factors can affect remote sensing accuracy by introducing errors in the radiometric temperature measurements and classification errors in the thermal images, as observed when soil pixels are misclassified as vegetation pixels. Ground-based observations might be impacted by sensor placement and calibration issues, as well as environmental factors like dust storms or desertification that are prevalent in arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土壤温度和湿度数据的变化可能受到多个因素的影响，包括地表的异质性、土壤和植被类型的差异，以及气候条件如降水和气温。这些因素可能通过引入辐射温度测量的误差和热图像中的分类错误，影响遥感的准确性，例如，当土壤像素被错误分类为植被像素时。地面观测可能受到传感器放置和校准问题的影响，以及在干旱地区普遍存在的环境因素，如沙尘暴或沙漠化。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of hydrometeorological and soil parameter data improve our understanding of the interactions between oasis and desert systems, and what implications might this have for sustainable development strategies in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 将水文气象和土壤参数数据的整合如何提高我们对绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的理解，以及这对干旱地区可持续发展战略可能产生的影响。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating hydrometeorological data, such as radiation, soil heat flux, and air temperature, with soil parameters like moisture and temperature profiles can enhance understanding of the complex interactions between oasis and desert systems. This comprehensive data integration allows for more accurate modeling of energy and water vapor exchanges, which is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in arid regions. Such an understanding could inform strategies aimed at balancing water resource management, agricultural productivity, and ecological conservation, ultimately aiding in achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 整合水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量和空气温度，以及土壤参数如湿度和温度剖面，可以增强对绿洲和沙漠系统之间复杂相互作用的理解。这种综合数据整合能够更准确地模拟能量和水蒸气的交换，这对于维持生态稳定和支持干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要。这种理解可以为平衡水资源管理、农业生产力和生态保护制定策略提供信息，最终有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas using ground-based measurements?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业地区，准确估计地表通量面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating surface fluxes are primarily due to the uncertainty in surface–air temperature differences, which can be dominant because of errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, strong advective environments and inaccuracies in the eddy covariance system measurements further complicate the estimation process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 估算表面通量的误差主要源于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性，这种不确定性可能是主导因素，因为从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被成分温度时会出现误差。此外，强的平流环境和涡度协方差系统测量的不准确性进一步复杂化了估算过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining this balance is crucial because oases support a significant portion of the population in arid regions and play a vital role in ecological stability and agricultural productivity. The oasis–desert system also significantly affects the carbon balance of these regions, which is important for achieving carbon neutrality and ecological security.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持这种平衡至关重要，因为绿洲支持了干旱地区相当大一部分人口，并在生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着重要作用。绿洲-沙漠系统还显著影响这些地区的碳平衡，这对于实现碳中和和生态安全至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limitations in the current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱地区当前复合温度分离方法局限性的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limitations arise due to errors in image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance, leading to misclassification of soil pixels as vegetation pixels. This results in overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can contribute to uncertainties in estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于图像分类中的错误，限制因素会随着植被丰度的变化而出现，导致土壤像素被错误分类为植被像素。这导致了对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽视大气的上行辐射和透射率也可能导致温度估计的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using different data collection intervals (e.g., every 10 minutes vs. every 30 minutes) on the reliability and accuracy of hydrometeorological observations in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，使用不同的数据收集间隔（例如每10分钟与每30分钟）对水文气象观测的可靠性和准确性会产生什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using different data collection intervals can impact the granularity and resolution of the data, potentially affecting the accuracy of capturing short-term fluctuations in hydrometeorological parameters. A shorter interval, such as every 10 minutes, provides more detailed data that can improve the precision of tracking rapid changes in weather conditions, which is crucial in arid and semi-arid regions where conditions can change quickly. Conversely, a longer interval, like every 30 minutes, might miss some of these variations but could reduce data volume and simplify processing. The choice of interval can influence the quality control processes and the ability to detect and correct anomalies in the data.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用不同的数据收集间隔会影响数据的粒度和分辨率，可能会影响捕捉水文气象参数短期波动的准确性。较短的间隔，例如每10分钟，提供更详细的数据，可以提高快速变化天气条件的跟踪精度，这在干旱和半干旱地区尤为重要，因为这些地区的条件变化迅速。相反，较长的间隔，如每30分钟，可能会错过一些这些变化，但可以减少数据量并简化处理。间隔的选择可以影响质量控制过程以及检测和纠正数据异常的能力。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the implications of sensor errors (e.g., long-wave radiation sensor issues) on the overall quality and usability of data collected for energy and water vapor exchange studies in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 传感器错误（例如，长波辐射传感器问题）对在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行能量和水汽交换研究所收集数据的整体质量和可用性可能产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Sensor errors, such as those affecting long-wave radiation measurements, can lead to data gaps and inaccuracies that compromise the quality of the data. These errors may result in unreliable estimates of key parameters like net radiation, which are crucial for understanding energy balance and evapotranspiration in oasis-desert ecosystems. The impact of such errors could necessitate additional data quality control measures and data imputation or correction techniques to ensure the dataset remains useful for analyses. Furthermore, persistent sensor issues might require recalibration or replacement to maintain data integrity over time.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 传感器错误，例如影响长波辐射测量的错误，可能导致数据缺失和不准确，从而影响数据质量。这些错误可能导致关键参数（如净辐射）的不可靠估计，而这些参数对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量平衡和蒸散发至关重要。这些错误的影响可能需要额外的数据质量控制措施以及数据插补或修正技术，以确保数据集在分析中仍然有用。此外，持续的传感器问题可能需要重新校准或更换，以维持数据的完整性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of collecting hydrometeorological data and soil parameters using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，使用自动气象站以10分钟平均周期收集水文气象数据和土壤参数的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas to recognize oasis-desert interactions and support the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. This understanding is crucial for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis-desert area.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换，以识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，并支持绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展。这种理解对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区碳达峰和碳中和的目标至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in artificial and natural oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统中，维持对能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测是至关重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, which is critical for maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems and achieving sustainable oasis development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要，这对维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡以及实现可持续的绿洲发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use both ground-based measurements and remote-sensing observations to investigate energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在研究绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换时，使用地面测量和遥感观测相结合是非常重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because extensive studies have shown that field and remote-sensing observations are necessary to investigate energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, which play a crucial role in maintaining ecological stability, supporting agricultural productivity, and affecting the carbon balance of arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为大量研究表明，实地和遥感观测对于研究绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换是必要的，这些地区在维持生态稳定、支持农业生产力以及影响干旱地区的碳平衡方面发挥着关键作用。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in setting up and maintaining an automatic weather station for long-term hydrometeorological data collection in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在干旱地区设置和维护自动气象站以进行长期水文气象数据收集的步骤包括：

1. **选址**：选择一个适合的地点，确保远离建筑物、树木和其他可能影响气象测量的障碍物。

2. **设备选择**：根据需要选择合适的气象传感器和设备，包括温度、湿度、风速、风向、降水量和太阳辐射等传感器。

3. **电源供应**：考虑使用太阳能电池板或其他可再生能源，以确保在偏远地区的持续供电。

4. **数据记录系统**：选择合适的数据记录器，能够存储和传输数据，确保数据的完整性和安全性。

5. **安装**：按照制造商的说明进行设备安装，确保所有传感器正确连接并校准。

6. **数据传输**：设置数据传输系统，可以使用无线网络、卫星通信或其他适合的方式将数据传输到中心数据库。

7. **维护计划**：制定定期维护和检查计划，包括清洁传感器、更换电池和检查设备的功能。

8. **数据管理**：建立数据管理系统，确保数据的存储、备份和分析，便于长期使用。

9. **培训人员**：对操作和维护人员进行培训，确保他们能够有效地管理气象站和处理数据。

10. **定期评估**：定期评估气象站的性能和数据质量，必要时进行调整和升级。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations are used to collect hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, and other relevant parameters. Data is collected at a 10-minute average period, ensuring consistent and accurate monitoring over time. Maintenance involves regular calibration and checks to ensure the integrity of sensors and data collection systems.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 自动气象站用于收集水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面及其他相关参数。数据以10分钟的平均周期进行收集，确保了长期监测的一致性和准确性。维护工作包括定期校准和检查，以确保传感器和数据收集系统的完整性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model applied to estimate components of evapotranspiration using soil and canopy temperatures?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型是如何应用于利用土壤和冠层温度估算蒸散发的组成部分的。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The TSEB model applies soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET). The model allows for the separation of latent heat fluxes of soil and canopy by calculating these using the surface energy balance model, with validation against measurements from systems like the eddy covariance.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: TSEB模型利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，以估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）。该模型通过使用表面能量平衡模型计算土壤和冠层的潜热通量，从而实现对其的分离，并与涡动协方差等系统的测量结果进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methodologies enable effective monitoring of soil and canopy component temperatures in arid and semi-arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够有效监测干旱和半干旱地区的土壤和冠层成分温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal camera, combined with field observations from a boundary layer tower, enables the measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures. Additionally, the integration of meteorological parameters, four-component radiations, and turbulent fluxes measured by an eddy covariance system supports effective monitoring.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用，结合来自边界层塔的现场观测，能够测量土壤和冠层组件的温度。此外，集成气象参数、四分量辐射和通过涡度协方差系统测量的湍流通量，支持有效的监测。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and technological tools are necessary to achieve high-quality data collection for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 为了在绿洲-沙漠系统中实现高质量的数据收集，必须具备哪些条件和技术工具，以便收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The establishment of a network of land surface flux and meteorological stations, including superstations and ordinary stations equipped with eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations, allows comprehensive data collection. Long-term observations, combined with auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, are essential for high-quality data collection in these systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 建立一个包括超级站和普通站的地表通量和气象站网络，这些站点配备了涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，可以进行全面的数据收集。长期观测结合水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，对于这些系统中的高质量数据收集至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in collecting accurate soil and canopy temperature data for use in energy balance models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在收集用于能量平衡模型的准确土壤和冠层温度数据时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting accurate soil and canopy temperature data include the need for precise classification of image pixels into soil and canopy categories, the influence of atmospheric conditions on radiative measurements, and the differentiation of surface component temperatures from composite temperatures. Errors can result from misclassification, atmospheric interference, and variations in vegetation cover, which could affect the performance of energy balance models like the TSEB model.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 收集准确的土壤和冠层温度数据面临的挑战包括需要精确分类图像像素为土壤和冠层类别、大气条件对辐射测量的影响，以及将表面组分温度与复合温度区分开来的困难。误差可能源于误分类、大气干扰和植被覆盖的变化，这可能会影响能量平衡模型（如TSEB模型）的性能。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using a four-component radiometer and eddy covariance (EC) system in collecting accurate hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱和半干旱地区使用四组件辐射计和涡度协方差（EC）系统收集准确的水文气象数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of a four-component radiometer and eddy covariance (EC) system appears to be effective for collecting accurate hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid regions, as they can measure crucial parameters like radiation and turbulent fluxes. However, challenges such as energy balance closure issues and errors in surface-air temperature difference determination may affect data accuracy, highlighting the need for careful calibration and validation.
